TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventLogRecord extends System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventRecord

Docs.summary: Contains the properties of an event instance for an event that is received from an object. The event properties provide information about the event such as the name of the computer where the event was logged and the time that the event was created.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ActivityId As Nullable(Of Guid)
public: virtual property Nullable<Guid> ActivityId { Nullable<Guid> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the activity in process for which the event is involved. This allows consumers to group related activities.
Docs.value: Returns a GUID value.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Bookmark As EventBookmark

Docs.summary: Gets a placeholder (bookmark) that corresponds to this event. This can be used as a placeholder in a stream of events.
Docs.value: Returns a object.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ContainerLog As String
public: property System::String ^ ContainerLog { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the event log or the event log file in which the event is stored.
Docs.value: Returns a string that contains the name of the event log or the event log file in which the event is stored.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

Docs.param: Selects the property values to return.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Id As Integer
public: virtual property int Id { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the identifier for this event. All events with this identifier value represent the same type of event.
Docs.value: Returns an integer value. This value can be null.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Keywords As Nullable(Of Long)
public: virtual property Nullable<long> Keywords { Nullable<long> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the keyword mask of the event. Get the value of the property to get the name of the keywords used in this mask.
Docs.value: Returns a long value. This value can be null.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The keywords for an event are used to group the event with other similar events based on the usage of the events. Each keyword is a bit in a 64-bit mask. Predefined bit values and reserved bits occupy the top 16 positions of this mask, leaving the manifest to use any bits between 0x0000000000000001 and 0x0000800000000000.
The standard event keywords are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventKeywords> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property KeywordsDisplayNames As IEnumerable(Of String)

Docs.summary: Gets the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerable collection of strings that contain the display names of the keywords used in the keyword mask for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event keywords are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventKeywords> enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Level As Nullable(Of Byte)
public: virtual property Nullable<System::Byte> Level { Nullable<System::Byte> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the level of the event. The level signifies the severity of the event. For the name of the level, get the value of the property.
Docs.value: Returns a byte value. This value can be null.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event levels are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

public: virtual property System::String ^ LevelDisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the display name of the level for this event.
Docs.value: Returns a string that contains the display name of the level for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event levels are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

public: virtual property System::String ^ LogName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.value: Returns a string that contains a name of the event log that contains this event.

public: virtual property System::String ^ MachineName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.value: Returns a string that contains the name of the computer on which this event was logged.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MatchedQueryIds As IEnumerable(Of Integer)

Docs.summary: Gets a list of query identifiers that this event matches. This event matches a query if the query would return this event.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerable collection of integer values.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Opcode As Nullable(Of Short)
public: virtual property Nullable<short> Opcode { Nullable<short> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the opcode of the event. The opcode defines a numeric value that identifies the activity or a point within an activity that the application was performing when it raised the event. For the name of the opcode, get the value of the property.
Docs.value: Returns a short value. This value can be null.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event opcodes are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventOpcode> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property OpcodeDisplayName As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ OpcodeDisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the display name of the opcode for this event.
Docs.value: Returns a string that contains the display name of the opcode for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event opcodes are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventOpcode> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ProcessId As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: virtual property Nullable<int> ProcessId { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the process identifier for the event provider that logged this event.
Docs.value: Returns an integer value. This value can be null.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ProviderName As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ ProviderName { System::String ^ get(); };

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Qualifiers As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: virtual property Nullable<int> Qualifiers { Nullable<int> get(); };

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property RecordId As Nullable(Of Long)
public: virtual property Nullable<long> RecordId { Nullable<long> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the event record identifier of the event in the log.
Docs.value: Returns a long value. This value can be null.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property RelatedActivityId As Nullable(Of Guid)
public: virtual property Nullable<Guid> RelatedActivityId { Nullable<Guid> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a globally unique identifier (GUID) for a related activity in a process for which an event is involved.
Docs.value: Returns a GUID value. This value can be null.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An event provider can set the value of the ActivityID attribute before publishing events. All the events that are published after this ID is set will have the ActivityID attribute set to the specified value. This allows providers to specify simple relationships between events. The events that are published are part of the same activity. When a provider must start a new, but related activity, the publisher can publish a transfer event and specify the new activity ID. This new ID will appear as a RelatedActivityID attribute. This allows consumers to group related activities.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Task As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: virtual property Nullable<int> Task { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a task identifier for a portion of an application or a component that publishes an event. A task is a 16-bit value with 16 top values reserved. This type allows any value between 0x0000 and 0xffef to be used. For the name of the task, get the value of the property.
Docs.value: Returns an integer value. This value can be null.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event tasks are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventTask> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property TaskDisplayName As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ TaskDisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the display name of the task for the event.
Docs.value: Returns a string that contains the display name of the task for the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The standard event tasks are defined in the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventTask> enumeration.

Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ThreadId As Nullable(Of Integer)
public: virtual property Nullable<int> ThreadId { Nullable<int> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the thread identifier for the thread that the event provider is running in.
Docs.value: Returns an integer value. This value can be null.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

public: virtual property Nullable<DateTime> TimeCreated { Nullable<DateTime> get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the time, in format, that the event was created.
Docs.value: Returns a value. The value can be null.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToXml() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToXml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the XML representation of the event. All of the event properties are represented in the event's XML. The XML conforms to the [event schema](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=81771).
Docs.returns: Returns a string that contains the XML representation of the event.
Docs.related: Technology Summary for Reading and Managing Event Logs
Event Log Scenarios

Docs.value: Returns a value.
